title: The true-lovers holidaies: or, The wooing, winning, and wedding of a fair damosel; performed by a lusty souldier, being one of the auxiliaries. The souldier woo'd the maid with words most kind, she answered him according to his mind. To the tune of, No body else shall plunder but I.
author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?
publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright.,
